Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>EagI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Correct	G. 7 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>SphI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Correct	H. 8 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>SdaI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Correct	F. 6 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>SplI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Correct	H. 8 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>NdeI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Correct	H. 8 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>NcoI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Correct	H. 8 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>DpnI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Incorrect	H. 8 kb	Correct	I. 9 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>NaeI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Correct	G. 7 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>MaeI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Correct	H. 8 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>BclI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Correct	G. 7 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>SplI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Correct	G. 7 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>SplI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Correct	F. 6 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>CciI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Correct	G. 7 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>MfeI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Correct	H. 8 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>SrfI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Correct	H. 8 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>PagI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Correct	F. 6 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>PagI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Correct	F. 6 kb	Correct	G. 7 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>TaiI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Incorrect	H. 8 kb	Correct	I. 9 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>SfoI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Correct	F. 6 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>NsiI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Correct	H. 8 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>CfoI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>PauI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Correct	G. 7 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>BfrI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Correct	F. 6 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>MroI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Correct	G. 7 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>KasI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Correct	H. 8 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>MscI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Correct	H. 8 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>SlaI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Incorrect	H. 8 kb	Incorrect	I. 9 kb	Correct	J. 10 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>DraI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Correct	H. 8 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>SalI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>SrfI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Correct	G. 7 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>SgsI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Incorrect	G. 7 kb	Incorrect	H. 8 kb	Correct	I. 9 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>EagI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Correct	F. 6 kb	Incorrect

Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>SciI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Incorrect	F. 6 kb	Correct	G. 7 kb	Incorrect
